Description: Small fragment of a seal-impression made of fine brown Nile clay that was hardened after excavation and shows darker discolouration and a partly glossy surface. The rear shows a small area with the impression of wood, probably from a bolt or a box knob, perpendicular to this two impressions of a turned cord with a width of 0.2 cm. The front side is flat running down towards the edges, covered with finger impressions and shows an almost round seal-impression. The motif is not clear, could be a standing figure in sunken relief.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E14.7 temple magazine
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
